text.__SUMMARY__: Bothrops fonsecai, or Fonseca's lancehead, is a species of venomous snake in the  family Viperidae. The species is endemic to Brazil.
text.Etymology: The specific name, fonsecai, is in honor of Dr. Flavio da Fonseca, who was head of the laboratory of parasitology at the Instituto Butantan in São Paulo, Brazil.
text.Geographic range: B. fonsecai is found in Brazil in the states of Minas Gerais, Rio de Janeiro, and São Paulo.
text.Further reading: Hoge RA, Belluomini HE (1959). "Uma nova espécie de Bothrops do Brasil (Serpentes) ". Memórias do Instituto Butantan 28: 195-206. (Bothrops fonsecai, new species). (in Portuguese).
